message: They alwas end up in default.
I want to move commits from default to a named branch and trying to use MQ for that purpose
Moving commits to patches in MQ is find but I cannot commit then back on a new branch
I have the feeling this is possible but I'm missing something to get the expected result. Anything I should know?
@davidpaccoud the method indicated by @keegan seems the right one

You can use the rebase extension. But otherwise assuming the queue contains the converted revisions
$ hg qpop -a
$ hg update namebranch
$ hg qpush -a
This seems to work for me for what I just tried out on a test repo. However, I remember having problems moving the qparent when I was first playing around with MQ.
Thx, I'm giving it a try
@keegan Yeah, this is working just fine. Thank you for your help.
Hg convert with branchmap I think would be simpler
